definition: to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request

sentences.english: Application for Registration of Increased Capital.
sentences.chinese: 辦理增資擴股工商註冊的請示。

sentences.english: Local authorities must refer everything to the central ministries.
sentences.chinese: 地方管理機構應請示中央主管部門。

sentences.english: I have to consult the manager about the matter.
sentences.chinese: 關於這件事我得向經理請示一下。

sentences.english: If you make a decision without consulting her , you're a chauvinist pig , you bastard .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不請示她而擅自做了決定，混帳，你這頭沙豬。

sentences.english: In advance, Li asked for instructions from Jiang's superiors about the dress at inauguration.
sentences.chinese: 事先，李宗仁向蔣介石請示典禮服問題。

sentences.english: The copilot returned to the cockpit and asked the captain what he should do.
sentences.chinese: 副機長回到駕駛室請示機長該怎麼做。

sentences.english: She issued all these invitations without any reference to her superiors.
sentences.chinese: 她未請示上級擅自把所有這些請柬都發了出去。

sentences.english: We are encountering clear ice. Request immediate right turn to heading 130.
sentences.chinese: 我們遇到了明冰，請示立即右轉至航向130。

sentences.english: We have a "Wind-shear Ahead" warning. Request to delay our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我們出現了“前方風切變”警告，請示推遲進近。

sentences.english: Ask it for guidance, and guidance will come.
sentences.chinese: 向它請示指向，引導就會來。
我們用無線電向北京請示。

sentences.english: High chief report to him for instructions, director of the void off mystery party.
sentences.chinese: 高局長向他報告請示，方處長奧祕掉蹤了。

sentences.english: We've got to report back to the head office.
sentences.chinese: 我們還要歸去向總部報告請示情形呢。

sentences.english: Gold deep water will status report to the higher authorities, spirit cabled Chongqing.
sentences.chinese: 金深水將狀況報告請示給上峯，革靈發電報給重慶。

sentences.english: At that time, General Tin Kwai asked how the draft order.
sentences.chinese: 其時，田畦請示將軍如何起草命令。

definition: to pass on a story/to communicate a message
to ask sb to resign from a post
to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
